I'm happy to help you find resources to dispose of your old mattress. Many people move their old mattress to another room, buy a mattress storage bag and keep it for visitors, give it to a friend, donate it, or even sell it. Here is some more helpful info:

Donate it!
There are tons of great places to donate your mattress. Try Goodwill, Salvation Army, or another charity of your choice. You might even be eligible to receive a tax-deductible receipt for your donation while helping out a great cause.

Sell it!
Depending on the condition of your mattress, you may be able to get as much as $250 or more. Prices for used mattresses could start as low as $50 and go up depending on the size, quality, and condition of your mattress. There are a number of great places to list your mattress (or other stuff) for free. Check out Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, LetGo, and OfferUp for quick and easy places to list.

All of our foams are eco-friendly and nontoxic as certified by CertiPUR-USÂ®. It means the foam in the bedding has been tested to meet CertiPUR-USÂ® rigorous standards for emissions, content, performance, and durability. 

Specifically, the foam is:
- Made without ozone depleters
- Made without PBDEs or the following Tris flame retardants: TCEP, TDBPP, TDCPP or TEPA

- Made without formaldehyde
- Made without phthalates regulated by the Consumer Product Safety Commission

The Siena is a supportive 10-inch 3-layer mattress. The first comfort layer is made up of 2" of gel-infused, polyurethane memory foam. The second layer is made up of 4" of support foam, and the sturdy base. The sturdy base is 4" of firm standing foam. These layers are wrapped in a soft and inviting polyester fabric.

Important: Please do not attempt to remove the cover to wash it. This will invalidate the warranty. For light spills and stains, you can spot clean with a damp cloth and mild detergent, or hand soap. For bigger or deeper stains, an upholstery cleaner or cleaning device should work well. But in both cases, take care not to let liquid reach the underlying foam layers. If you remove the mattress cover, it's possible to damage the foam layers. And as mentioned, this will invalidate your warranty.

If you're worried about stains, we recommend using a water resistant mattress protector (you can buy these in the accessories section on this site). This protector can then be removed from time to time and laundered.
